DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Initiated By" : "UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION",
  "Allegations" : "SEC LITIGATION RELEASE 23182 / JANUARY 29, 2015: THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ANNOUNCED FRAUD CHARGES AGAINST A WISCONSIN-BASED INSURANCE BROKERAGE FIRM AND ITS PRESIDENT, LOREN W. HOLZHUETER, FOR CONDUCTING A PONZI SCHEME WITH MONEY THEY SOLICITED FOR INVESTMENT PURPOSES.  THE COMPLAINT ALLEGES THAT, BASED ON THIS CONDUCT, HOLZHUETER VIOLATED SECTION 10(B) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 AND RULE 10B-5 THEREUNDER AND SECTION 17(A) OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933. THE COURT ENTERED A TEMPORARY RESTRAINING ORDER FREEZING ASSETS AND PROHIBITING CONTINUING VIOLATIONS OF THE SECURITIES LAWS. IN ITS COMPLAINT, FILED ON JANUARY 21, 2015 IN FEDERAL DISTRICT COURT IN THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WISCONSIN, THE SEC ALLEGES THAT LOREN W. HOLZHUETER AND HIS FIRM, THE INSURANCE BROKERAGE FIRM, RAISED AT LEAST $10.4 MILLION FROM APPROXIMATELY 120 INVESTORS SINCE JANUARY 2008 WHO WERE MISLED TO BELIEVE THEIR INVESTMENTS WOULD BE PLACED IN SEPARATE INVESTMENT ACCOUNTS AT THE FIRM OR WOULD BE USED TO EXPAND THE FIRM'S BUSINESS BY ACQUIRING OTHER INSURANCE AGENCIES. THE COMPLAINT ALLEGES THAT THE FIRM INSTEAD DEPOSITED INVESTOR FUNDS DIRECTLY INTO ITS GENERAL ACCOUNTS. HOLZHUETER AND THE FIRM SIPHONED INVESTOR MONEY TO FUND THE FIRM'S PAYROLL AND GENERAL OPERATIONS AS WELL AS TO PAY OFF EXISTING BANK DEBTS. THE FIRM PAID SOME INVESTOR MONEY TO HOLZHUETER AND ENTITIES UNDER HIS CONTROL. THE FIRM ALSO USED MONEY RAISED FROM NEWER INVESTORS TO MAKE INTEREST AND PRINCIPAL PAYMENTS TO EARLIER INVESTORS. ACCORDING TO THE SEC'S COMPLAINT, HOLZHUETER AND HIS FIRM HID CRITICAL PIECES OF INFORMATION FROM INVESTORS, INCLUDING THAT THE FIRM'S RECORDS HAD BEEN SEIZED BY THE IRS PURSUANT TO A SEARCH WARRANT.",
  "Resolution" : "Judgment Rendered",

  "Sanctions" : "see comments"
}
